title: ‘World Series’: From Baseball to Poker, a Title That Aspires to Span the Planet
text:
Major League Baseball’s World Series, as usual, isn’t exactly worldly this year. The matchup of the American League’s Houston Astros and the National League’s Washington Nationals pits two teams representing the parochial confines of the U.S. Only in 1992 and 1993 has the baseball championship included a non-American team, when the Toronto Blue Jays competed and won both years, bringing glory to Canada.

The bold name has inspired brash imitators: The Little League championship adopted the “World Series” label in 1949 but...
description: The major-league championship is still mostly a U.S. affair, but others using the term have gone truly global
